title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ€™ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [conduct@tradingverse.org] opening issue. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozillaâ€™s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
code: # Ubuntu/Debian sudo apt-get install gdebi-core wget https://download3.rstudio.org/ubuntu-18.04/x86_64/shiny-server-1.5.20.1002-amd64.deb sudo gdebi shiny-server-1.5.20.1002-amd64.deb  # macOS (via Docker) docker run -p 3838:3838 rocker/shiny

previous_headings: Deployment Options > Option 3: Shiny Server (Production Deployment)
title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
code: # Copy app to Shiny Server directory sudo cp -R /path/to/tradedash /srv/shiny-server/tradedash  # Access at: http://your-server:3838/tradedash

title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
text: Best : Easy cloud deployment, server management Visit: https://-account.shinyapps.io/tradedash Pricing: - Free tier: 5 apps, 25 active hours/month - Starter: $9/mo - Basic: $39/mo - Standard: $99/mo
code: # Install rsconnect install.packages("rsconnect")  # Configure account (first time only) rsconnect::setAccountInfo(   name = "your-account",   token = "your-token",   secret = "your-secret" )  # Deploy library(rsconnect) deployApp(appDir = "path/to/tradedash")

title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
text: Best : Reproducible deployment, cloud platforms Create Dockerfile: Build run:
code: FROM rocker/shiny:latest  # Install system dependencies RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \     libcurl4-openssl-dev \     libssl-dev \     libxml2-dev  # Install R packages RUN R -e "install.packages(c('devtools', 'shiny', 'shinydashboard', 'plotly', 'DT'))" RUN R -e "devtools::install_github('Traderverse/tradedash')"  # Copy app COPY app.R /srv/shiny-server/ COPY config.yaml /srv/shiny-server/  # Expose port EXPOSE 3838  # Run CMD ["/init"] docker build -t tradedash . docker run -p 3838:3838 tradedash

title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
text: Best : Enterprise deployment, scalability AWS: EC2 + Shiny Server ECS Docker Azure: VM + Shiny Server Container Instances GCP: Compute Engine + Shiny Server Cloud Run

title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
text: Create config.yaml: Use :
code: # Dashboard appearance theme: "dark" chart_theme: "trading_dark"  # Data settings data_source: "yahoo" symbols: ["AAPL", "MSFT", "GOOGL", "AMZN", "TSLA"] refresh_rate: 5000  # milliseconds  # Trading parameters initial_capital: 100000 commission: 0.001  # 0.1% slippage: 0.0005   # 0.05%  # API keys (optional) alpha_vantage_key: "your-key-here" iex_cloud_key: "your-key-here"  # Notifications enable_notifications: true notification_methods: ["browser", "email"] alert_email: "your@email.com" launch_dashboard(config_file = "config.yaml")

title: TradeDash Deployment Guide
text: Authentication - Add user login (requires Shiny Server Pro custom auth) HTTPS - Use SSL certificates encrypted connections API Keys - Store securely environment variables secrets manager Firewall - Restrict port access known IPs Rate Limiting - Prevent API abuse

code: # In R Sys.setenv(ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY = "your-key") Sys.setenv(IEX_CLOUD_KEY = "your-key")  # Access in app api_key <- Sys.getenv("ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY")

text: Bug fix (non-breaking change fixes issue) New feature (non-breaking change adds functionality) Breaking change (fix feature cause existing functionality work expected) Documentation update Performance improvement Code refactoring Test improvements

title: Security Policy
text: release patches security vulnerabilities following versions:

title: Security Policy
text: take security TradingVerse seriously. discover security vulnerability, please follow steps:

what: 1. Do Not Open a Public Issue
title: Security Policy
text: Please open public GitHub issue security vulnerabilities. helps prevent vulnerability exploited fix available.

title: Security Policy
text: Report security vulnerabilities via one methods: Email: security@tradingverse.org (preferred) GitHub Security Advisory: Use â€œReport vulnerabilityâ€ button Security tab Direct Message: Contact maintainer directly

title: Security Policy
text: Please include: Description vulnerability Steps reproduce issue Potential impact suggested fixes (optional) contact information follow-

title: Security Policy
text: Acknowledgment: Within 48 hours Initial Assessment: Within 1 week Critical: Within 7 days High: Within 30 days Medium: Within 90 days Low: Next regular release

title: Security Policy
text: work understand resolve issue notify affected users fix available credit security advisory (unless prefer remain anonymous) follow responsible disclosure practices

title: Security Policy
text: TradingVerse primarily designed educational research purposes. using production trading environments: API Keys: Never commit API keys credentials repository Data Privacy: cautious sensitive trading data Financial Risk: Understand bugs result financial losses Testing: Thoroughly test strategies paper trading live deployment Compliance: Ensure compliance relevant financial regulations

title: Security Policy
text: Use environment variables sensitive data Regularly update dependencies Review code deploying production Use secure connections (HTTPS) data fetching Implement proper error handling logging Follow principle least privilege

title: Security Policy
text: Past security advisories published : https://github.com/Traderverse/tradingverse/security/advisories

title: Security Policy
text: questions security policy, please open discussion GitHub Discussions forum contact us security@tradingverse.org. Remember: open-source software provided â€œâ€ without warranty. Users responsible trading decisions risk management.

text: Team T (2025). tradedash: Interactive Trading Dashboard TradingVerse. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Traderverse/tradedash.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tradedash: Interactive Trading Dashboard for TradingVerse},   author = {TradingVerse Team},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/Traderverse/tradedash}, }

title: tradedash â€¢ Interactive Trading Dashboard
text: Professional Trading Dashboard TradingVerse Real-time market monitoring â€¢ Strategy development â€¢ Backtesting â€¢ Portfolio analytics  tradedash production-ready Shiny dashboard unifies TradingVerse packages single, powerful interface. Designed quantitative traders, portfolio managers, financial analysts need professional-grade tools.

title: Launch TradingVerse Dashboard â€” launch_dashboard
text: Launch complete TradingVerse dashboard application. main entry point unified trading platform integrates TradingVerse packages single interface.

title: Launch TradingVerse Dashboard â€” launch_dashboard
code: launch_dashboard(   mode = "full",   port = 3838,   host = "127.0.0.1",   launch.browser = TRUE,   config_file = NULL )

title: Launch TradingVerse Dashboard â€” launch_dashboard
text: mode Dashboard mode: "full" (default), "live", "backtest", "portfolio" port Port number Shiny app (default: 3838) host Host address (default: "127.0.0.1") launch.browser Launch browser automatically (default: TRUE) config_file Path configuration YAML file (optional)
